title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0001
text: What is the main purpose of server-side service discovery in microservices?

options.text: To delegate service instance selection to a load balancer or router
To let clients directly locate service instances

explanation: In server-side discovery, the load balancer or router selects the appropriate service instance on behalf of the client.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0002
text: Which component is responsible for routing requests in server-side discovery?
explanation: A load balancer or API Gateway routes client requests to available service instances in server-side discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0003
text: In server-side discovery, who queries the service registry?
explanation: The load balancer or router queries the service registry to find available service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0004
text: Which of the following best describes the workflow of server-side discovery?

options.text: Client sends request → Load balancer queries registry → Routes to instance
Client queries registry → Selects instance → Sends request

explanation: In server-side discovery, the client sends a request to a load balancer, which queries the registry and routes the request.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a common tool used for server-side discovery?
explanation: AWS Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) is a common example of a server-side discovery mechanism.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of server-side discovery?

options.text: Eliminates the need for a load balancer
Removes the need for a registry

explanation: Server-side discovery simplifies client logic because the client does not need to handle service discovery or load balancing.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of server-side discovery?
explanation: Server-side discovery introduces an additional network hop because requests go through a load balancer or gateway.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0008
text: Which of the following best describes the role of the service registry?

options.text: Maintains a list of available service instances

explanation: The service registry maintains a list of available service instances and their network locations.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for scalability?

options.text: Load balancer distributes traffic across instances

explanation: The load balancer distributes traffic across service instances, improving scalability.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for maintainability?

options.text: Clients are decoupled from service instance details

explanation: Server-side discovery decouples clients from service instance details, simplifying maintenance.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for fault tolerance?

options.text: Load balancer can avoid unhealthy instances

explanation: The load balancer can detect and avoid unhealthy instances, improving fault tolerance.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a common registry used in server-side discovery?
explanation: Consul is a popular service registry that supports both client-side and server-side discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for security?

options.text: Clients do not directly access service instances

explanation: Server-side discovery improves security by preventing clients from directly accessing service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a challenge of server-side discovery?

options.text: Load balancer becomes a potential bottleneck

explanation: The load balancer can become a bottleneck if not properly scaled or configured.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for performance?
explanation: The load balancer optimizes routing decisions to improve performance and reduce latency.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for simplicity?

options.text: Clients are unaware of service topology

explanation: Server-side discovery simplifies clients by hiding service topology and routing logic.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for maintainability?

options.text: Each client maintains its own registry

explanation: Centralized routing logic in the load balancer simplifies maintenance and updates.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0018
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for scalability?
explanation: Load balancers can scale horizontally to handle increased traffic and maintain performance.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0019
text: Which of the following is a benefit of server-side discovery for fault isolation?

options.text: Failures in one service do not affect others
Clients depend on a single router

explanation: Server-side discovery isolates faults by routing around failed instances.

options.text: Clients send requests to a load balancer that routes to service instances
Clients directly discover and connect to service instances

Clients communicate only through the registry

explanation: In server-side discovery, clients send requests to a load balancer, which routes them to available service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServerSide - Q0021
